snippet: The problems with internal polls may run deeper than the tendency for campaigns to report them to the public in a selective way. The campaigns may also be fooling themselves.
abstract: The problems with internal polls may run deeper than the tendency for campaigns to report them to the public in a selective way. The campaigns may also be fooling themselves.

headline.main: When Internal Polls Mislead, a Whole Campaign May Be to Blame
headline.print_headline: Spin and Bias Are the Norm In Campaigns’ Internal Polling
